title: (x) Looking for s.t. similar to Emery Frost logo - Blender, Gridnik {Randall Laurence Smith, Michael A}
content:
I'm after something similar to this particular typeface. I am aware that it is the logotype used by Emery Vincent (formely known as emeryfrost), just thought there might be something comparable to it out there.

[http://www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/55587.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20141230235913/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/55587.jpg "http://www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/55587.jpg")
author: benski

comments.content: oh maybe i was thinking of blender... try that one.
I think Foundry Gridnik is even closer.

It looks like a 45-degree military font to me (but then it would). Some of these only have upper case letters:

[AmarilloUSAF](http://web.archive.org/web/20141230235913/http:/www.tlai.com/med_des/amusaf.html)  
 [KPDuty JNL](http://web.archive.org/web/20141230235913/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/kp-duty/)  
 [B-52-ULC](http://web.archive.org/web/20141230235913/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/stockbucket/b-52/b52-ulc/)  
 [United](http://web.archive.org/web/20141230235913/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=531&subpage=un_fonts_sans) (House Industries)

I don't know if any of these will work:

[http://hans.presto.tripod.com/fonts/stencil5.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20141230235913/http:/hans.presto.tripod.com/fonts/stencil5.html "http://hans.presto.tripod.com/fonts/stencil5.html")

ChrisL
